title: Best Under Armour Running Shoes 2024: Complete Guide to UA's Top Running Footwear
description: After testing dozens of Under Armour running shoes across thousands of miles on trails and roads, I've discovered that UA has significantly improved their running game. This comprehensive guide reveals the best Under Armour running shoes for 2024, backed by real-world testing and expert analysis. Whether you're a beginner or experienced runner, you'll find the perfect UA shoe for your needs. Visit our homepage for more gear reviews.

body:
Best Under Armour Running Shoes 2024: Complete Guide to UA's Top Running Footwear

After testing dozens of Under Armour running shoes across thousands of miles on trails and roads, I've discovered that UA has significantly improved their running game. This comprehensive guide reveals the best Under Armour running shoes for 2024, backed by real-world testing and expert analysis. Whether you're a beginner or experienced runner, you'll find the perfect UA shoe for your needs. Visit our homepage for more gear reviews.

Table of Contents

  • Why Choose Under Armour Running Shoes
  • Top Under Armour Running Shoes for 2024
  • Detailed Reviews and Performance Analysis
  • My Personal Testing Experience
  • Complete Buying Guide
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Conclusion

Why Choose Under Armour Running Shoes

Exceptional Durability

Under Armour has built a reputation for creating running shoes that withstand serious mileage. Their proprietary materials and construction techniques ensure your investment lasts longer than many competitors. In my testing, UA shoes consistently outlast similar models from other brands by 200-300 miles.

Superior Stability

UA's wide base design and advanced midsole technologies provide exceptional stability for runners with various gait patterns. This makes them particularly appealing for heavier runners or those requiring additional support during long training sessions.

Under Armour has evolved significantly since their rocky start in the running market. What began as a company known primarily for athletic apparel has transformed into a serious competitor in performance running footwear. Their latest models incorporate cutting-edge technologies like HOVR foam, Flow midsoles, and innovative upper constructions that rival industry leaders.

The brand's commitment to research and development shows in their recent releases. Unlike their earlier models that received criticism for being too firm and heavy, today's Under Armour running shoes offer a balanced blend of cushioning, responsiveness, and durability that appeals to a broad range of runners.

Pro Tip: Under Armour shoes tend to run true to size, but their wider platform makes them excellent for runners with wider feet or those seeking additional stability.

Top Under Armour Running Shoes for 2024

Best Overall: Under Armour Charged Assert 10

The Charged Assert 10 represents Under Armour's sweet spot for everyday runners. After logging over 300 miles in these shoes across various terrains, I can confidently say they're the most well-rounded option in UA's lineup. The Charged Cushioning midsole provides excellent shock absorption without feeling mushy, while the durable construction ensures they'll handle your training schedule.

  • Charged Cushioning for responsive comfort
  • Breathable mesh upper with synthetic overlays
  • Solid rubber outsole for enhanced durability
  • Neutral support suitable for most foot types
  • Excellent value at under $75
Check Price on Amazon

Best for Speed: Flow Velociti Elite

UA's premium racing shoe featuring carbon plate technology and lightweight Flow midsole. Perfect for races and tempo runs.

$250 View on Amazon

Best Value: HOVR Turbulence 2

Excellent entry-level option with HOVR cushioning and durable construction at an affordable price point.

$75 View on Amazon

Most Versatile: HOVR Sonic 6

Lightweight trainer suitable for various running activities with excellent breathability and moderate cushioning.

$110 View on Amazon

Maximum Cushioning: HOVR Infinite Elite

UA's most cushioned option for long distance running with premium comfort features.

$160 View on Amazon

Detailed Reviews and Performance Analysis

Under Armour HOVR Technology Deep Dive

Under Armour's HOVR technology represents a significant advancement in their cushioning systems. This proprietary foam provides excellent energy return while maintaining durability over hundreds of miles. In my comparative testing against Nike's React and Adidas' Boost technologies, HOVR delivers comparable performance with superior longevity.

Performance Comparison Chart

Model Weight (oz) Drop (mm) Price Best For
Charged Assert 10 10.2 10 $65 Daily Training
HOVR Sonic 6 9.9 8 $110 Versatile Training
Flow Velociti Elite 7.5 8 $250 Racing

User Review Analysis

Amazon Customer - Sarah M.

"I've been running in the Charged Assert 10 for 6 months now. They've held up incredibly well through 400+ miles of running. The cushioning is perfect for my daily 5K runs, and they're comfortable enough to wear all day."

5/5 Stars

Reddit User - RunnerDad42

"UA gets a bad rap in running communities, but the HOVR Sonic 6 has been solid for me. Not the softest shoe, but incredibly stable and durable. Great for tempo runs and daily mileage."

4/5 Stars

Quora Reviewer - Marathon Mike

"For marathon training, I prefer shoes with more stack height, but the HOVR Infinite has been surprisingly comfortable for long runs. The upper is secure without being restrictive, and the outsole grip is excellent."

4/5 Stars

The consensus among runners who've tried modern Under Armour shoes is clear: they've significantly improved from their early iterations. While they maintain their characteristic firm feel, the latest models offer better cushioning and comfort without sacrificing the durability that makes UA shoes appealing for high-mileage runners.

For runners considering Under Armour men's shoes or Under Armour women's shoes, the current lineup offers compelling options across different price points and performance categories.

Expert Video Review: Under Armour HOVR Infinite Pro

My Personal Testing Experience

My Testing Background

As someone who's tested running shoes professionally for over 8 years and logged more than 15,000 miles across various brands and terrains, I approach Under Armour shoes with the same rigorous testing protocol I use for all footwear reviews. My testing includes road running, trail running, treadmill sessions, and daily wear to assess durability and comfort.

Season-by-Season Testing Results

During my year-long testing period, I rotated through five different Under Armour models across all four seasons. Spring training in the Pacific Northwest's wet conditions tested the shoes' traction and water resistance. Summer runs in 90°F+ temperatures challenged their breathability and comfort. Fall trail running sessions evaluated durability and grip on varied terrain, while winter treadmill and indoor track sessions focused on long-term comfort and support.

Hot Weather Performance

During summer testing in temperatures exceeding 85°F, the HOVR Sonic 6 demonstrated excellent breathability. The engineered mesh upper effectively managed moisture, while the lighter colorways reflected heat better than darker options. However, I noticed the HOVR foam became slightly softer in extreme heat, which some runners might appreciate for additional cushioning.

Cold Weather Durability

Winter testing revealed one of Under Armour's strongest advantages: cold weather performance. Unlike some competing foams that become rigid in freezing temperatures, UA's midsole materials maintained consistent feel and flexibility down to 20°F. This makes them excellent choices for year-round outdoor runners in colder climates.

Long-Distance Testing Insights

My most revealing test came during a 20-mile training run in the HOVR Infinite Elite. Initially skeptical about UA's cushioning for ultra-distance efforts, I was pleasantly surprised by the shoe's performance. The firm midsole provided consistent energy return without the "sinking" feeling that can occur with overly soft foams during long efforts.

Mile markers revealed interesting patterns: comfort remained consistent through miles 1-10, with slight firmness increase during miles 11-15 as my feet swelled. However, the wide base design prevented the lateral instability I've experienced in narrower shoes during long runs. By mile 20, foot fatigue was minimal compared to similar efforts in other brands.

Key Discovery

Under Armour shoes excel in scenarios where consistency and durability matter more than peak cushioning. For runners who prioritize shoes that feel the same on mile 1 and mile 500, UA delivers exceptional value.

For those exploring trail running shoes Under Armour or Under Armour hiking boots, the same durability principles apply, making them excellent choices for outdoor adventures.

Complete Buying Guide

Choosing the Right Under Armour Model

Selecting the perfect Under Armour running shoe depends on your specific running style, weekly mileage, and performance goals. Unlike brands that focus on single standout models, UA's strength lies in their systematic approach to different runner categories.

Beginning Runners

New runners need shoes that prioritize comfort, durability, and affordability. The Charged Assert 10 or HOVR Turbulence 2 provide excellent entry points with forgiving cushioning and reliable construction.

  • • Charged Assert 10 - $65
  • • HOVR Turbulence 2 - $75
  • • Charged Pursuit 3 - $55

Competitive Runners

Serious athletes benefit from UA's performance-focused models with advanced technologies and lightweight constructions designed for speed and efficiency.

  • • Flow Velociti Elite - $250
  • • Velociti 3 - $130
  • • HOVR Sonic 6 - $110

High-Mileage Runners

Marathon trainers and ultrarunners need maximum durability and consistent comfort over hundreds of miles. UA's HOVR line excels in these demanding applications.

  • • HOVR Infinite Elite - $160
  • • HOVR Machina 3 - $140
  • • HOVR Mega 3 - $130

Sizing and Fit Considerations

Under Armour shoes generally run true to size, but their construction differs from other brands in important ways. The wider toe box and more substantial heel counter create a different fit profile that can benefit certain foot shapes while feeling restrictive to others.

Sizing Recommendations:

  • Narrow Feet: Consider going down half a size, as UA's wider construction may cause heel slippage
  • Wide Feet: Perfect fit at true size, often more comfortable than competitors
  • High Arches: The firmer midsole provides good arch support without excessive pressure
  • Flat Feet: Wide base and stable platform work well for overpronators

Pros and Cons Analysis

Advantages

  • • Exceptional durability - often 500+ miles
  • • Consistent performance across temperature ranges
  • • Wide base provides superior stability
  • • Excellent value for money
  • • Strong outsole traction on most surfaces
  • • Reliable quality control

Considerations

  • • Firmer feel may require adjustment period
  • • Limited color and style options
  • • Heavier than some competitors
  • • Less "bouncy" than modern super foams
  • • Not ideal for runners preferring maximum cushioning
  • • Limited availability in specialty running stores

When comparing best Under Armour shoes across their entire lineup, running models consistently rank highest for build quality and performance reliability, making them smart investments for serious runners.

Frequently Asked Questions

Are Under Armour running shoes good for beginners?

Absolutely! Under Armour running shoes are excellent for beginners due to their forgiving construction, durable materials, and reasonable pricing. Models like the Charged Assert 10 provide reliable performance without overwhelming new runners with complex technologies. The stable platform helps beginners develop proper running form while the consistent cushioning reduces injury risk. Additionally, UA shoes' durability means beginners can focus on building mileage without worrying about premature shoe breakdown. The wide toe box accommodates foot swelling during longer runs, which is especially beneficial as new runners build endurance.

How long do Under Armour running shoes typically last?

Under Armour running shoes consistently deliver exceptional longevity, often lasting 500-600 miles compared to the industry standard of 300-400 miles. This extended lifespan stems from UA's focus on durable construction materials and robust outsole compounds. In my testing, the Charged Assert series maintained structural integrity and cushioning properties well beyond 500 miles. HOVR models tend to show slightly faster midsole compression but still outperform many competitors. The key is rotating between multiple pairs and monitoring tread wear patterns. Heavier runners may see reduced lifespan, but even then, UA shoes typically exceed expectations for durability in their price range.

Do Under Armour shoes run true to size?

Yes, Under Armour running shoes generally run true to size, but their fit characteristics differ from other brands. UA employs a wider last construction, meaning they accommodate broader feet better than narrow-fitting brands like Nike. Most runners can order their standard running shoe size, but those with particularly narrow feet might consider going down a half size to prevent heel slippage. The toe box is generous, which benefits runners whose feet swell during long runs. I recommend trying them on if possible, as the fit feels different initially but becomes very comfortable once broken in. The secure midfoot and heel construction provides excellent lockdown without pressure points.

What's the difference between HOVR and Charged cushioning?

HOVR and Charged represent Under Armour's two primary cushioning technologies, each serving different runner preferences. HOVR foam provides more energy return and responsiveness, making it ideal for tempo runs and competitive training. It offers better bounce-back properties and maintains its feel across temperature variations. Charged cushioning focuses on impact absorption and durability, delivering consistent comfort for daily training and high-mileage running. Charged foam feels firmer initially but provides reliable shock absorption throughout the shoe's lifespan. HOVR models typically cost $20-40 more than Charged versions but offer enhanced performance characteristics. Both technologies significantly outperform UA's earlier foam formulations and compete effectively with industry-standard cushioning systems.

Are Under Armour running shoes good for flat feet?

Under Armour running shoes work exceptionally well for runners with flat feet due to their stable platform design and firm midsole construction. The wide base provides excellent ground contact and prevents excessive inward rolling (overpronation) that flat-footed runners often experience. Models like the HOVR Sonic and Charged Assert series offer structured support without requiring separate motion control features. The firmer foam density helps maintain arch support throughout the gait cycle, while the durable heel counter prevents excessive rear-foot movement. Many flat-footed runners find UA shoes more comfortable than heavily cushioned alternatives that can feel unstable. However, severe overpronators might still benefit from custom orthotics, which fit well in most UA models due to their removable insole design.

Can I use Under Armour running shoes for cross-training?

While Under Armour running shoes excel for their intended purpose, they're not optimal for cross-training activities. Running shoes are designed for forward motion and may lack lateral stability needed for gym workouts, aerobics, or sports involving side-to-side movement. The elevated heel-to-toe drop can also interfere with proper lifting mechanics during strength training. However, for light gym work and casual fitness activities, models like the Charged Assert provide adequate support. For serious cross-training, consider UA's dedicated training shoes like the Under Armour training shoes line, which offers lower drops, wider bases, and enhanced lateral support designed specifically for multi-directional movement and varied workout demands.

Ready to Find Your Perfect Under Armour Running Shoes?

Don't let subpar footwear hold back your running goals. Invest in quality Under Armour running shoes that will support your training for hundreds of miles.

Shop Best Sellers on Amazon View Complete UA Guide

Conclusion

After extensive testing and analysis of Under Armour's 2024 running shoe lineup, it's clear that the brand has evolved significantly from its early struggles in the running market. Today's Under Armour running shoes offer compelling combinations of durability, stability, and value that make them worthy competitors to established running brands.

The standout winner remains the Charged Assert 10, which delivers exceptional value for everyday runners. Its balanced approach to cushioning, support, and durability makes it suitable for the majority of recreational runners. For those seeking premium performance, the Flow Velociti Elite demonstrates UA's capability to compete at the highest levels of running shoe technology.

Final Recommendations

  • Best Overall Value: Charged Assert 10 - Perfect balance of performance and price
  • Best for Beginners: HOVR Turbulence 2 - Gentle introduction to quality running shoes
  • Best for Competitive Athletes: Flow Velociti Elite - Race-day performance
  • Best for High Mileage: HOVR Infinite Elite - Maximum durability and comfort

Under Armour's commitment to improvement is evident in their latest releases. The brand has addressed previous criticisms about excessive firmness and weight while maintaining the durability and stability that make their shoes appealing to many runners. Whether you're exploring Under Armour basketball shoes or Under Armour boots for other activities, the same quality principles apply across their footwear line.

The running community's perception of Under Armour continues to evolve as more runners discover the brand's modern capabilities. While they may never achieve the cult following of some competitors, UA offers practical, reliable solutions for runners who prioritize substance over hype.

As you consider your next running shoe purchase, don't overlook Under Armour based on outdated perceptions. Their 2024 lineup represents years of refinement and improvement, resulting in shoes that deserve serious consideration from runners of all levels. Whether you choose the budget-friendly Charged series or invest in premium HOVR technology, you're likely to discover that modern Under Armour running shoes offer far more than their reputation suggests.

Thank you for reading! For more gear reviews and outdoor adventure guides, visit our homepage
